intro: Primula gemmifera var. zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambales primrose, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
